thread.title: Uttar Pradesh elections 2017: Lalu Prasad to campaign for SP-Congress alliance in Uttar Pradesh | Uttar Pradesh Elections 2017
thread.title_full: Uttar Pradesh elections 2017: Lalu Prasad to campaign for SP-Congress alliance in Uttar Pradesh | Uttar Pradesh Elections 2017 - Times of India

author: Madan Kumar
title: Uttar Pradesh elections 2017: Lalu Prasad to campaign for SP-Congress alliance in Uttar Pradesh | Uttar Pradesh Elections 2017
text:
PATNA: Accepting an invitation from Congress chief Sonia Gandhi's daughter Priyanka Gandhi, RJD boss Lalu Prasad on Monday left for Lucknow to campaign in favour of the candidates of the SP-Congress alliance in different assembly segments of Rae Bareilly and Amethi constituencies in Uttar Pradesh.
Rae Bareilly and Amethi are represented by Sonia Gandhi and her son and Congress Vice President Rahul Gandhi, respectively, in the Lok Sabha. Priyanka is holding the command of poll campaigning in both the prestigious parliamentary constituencies.
"From Lucknow, Lalu Prasad will visit different assembly segments in Rae Bareilly on Tuesday and campaign in favour of the SP-Congress alliance. Tuesday is the last day for campaigning in Rae Bareilly district that is going to polls in the fourth phase on February 23," RJD chief's public relations officer Syed Shamim told TOI.
He said the RJD chief would campaign in different assembly segments of Amethi on Wednesday. Voting is scheduled for Amethi on February 27 in the fifth phase.
"We are yet to receive the name of assembly segments where Lalu Prasad will campaign. The assembly segments will be decided by Priyanka Gandhi and Lalu ji will get the list when he will start for Rae Bareilly on Tuesday morning," a political aide of the RJD chief told TOI on Monday.
Before leaving for UP, Lalu attacked PM Narendra Modi for making unsuccessful attempt to divide voters on communal line by raising issues like 'Shamshan' and 'Kabristan'.
Slamming the PM with a tinge of sarcasm, Lalu asked, "Who has stopped you from constructing cremation grounds and waiving farmers' loans? Should a person with a 56-inch chest mislead the country by resorting to meek ways?"
In a tweet posted on Monday, Lalu said that PM Narendra Modi is a dictator and the unity and integrity of the country is not safe under his leadership.
